snippet: Capt. Amadou Haya Sanogo said he would hold a national convention to agree on a transitional government that would organize free and fair elections.
abstract: Captain Amadou Haya Sanogo, junior officer who overthrew Mali's democratically elected Pres Amadou Toumani Toure and dissolved nation's Constitution, promises to reinstate the 1992 Constitution and hold elections; Mali's neighbors have given the country a 72-hour deadline to restore constitutional order or face sanctions.
lead_paragraph: Capt. Amadou Haya Sanogo said he would hold a national convention to agree on a transitional government that would organize free and fair elections.

headline.main: Mali Coup Leader, Facing Sanction Threats, Promises to Hold Elections
headline.print_headline: Mali Coup Leader, Facing Sanction Threats, Promises Elections

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
